description: theoretically this isn't a book at all

name.str_pl: copies of Mycenacean Hymns

description: A vellum book containing the hymns central to the Marloss faith.  As the verses lead into each other, the text sings of unity and promised paradise.

name.str_pl: copies of King James Bible

description: An English translation of the Christian Bible, which originated in England in the early 1600s.

name.str_pl: copies of Eastern Orthodox Bible

description: An English copy of the Eastern Orthodox translation of the Christian Bible.

name.str_pl: copies of Gideon Bible

description: An English translation of the Christian Bible, distributed free of charge by Gideons International.

name.str_pl: copies of the New Bible

description: An English translation of the Bible first published in 1970.  It is accepted by the Catholic dioceses of the United States of America and the Philippines.

name.str: The New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures
name.str_pl: copies of the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures

description: An English translation of the Bible published by the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society, used and distributed by Jehovah's Witnesses

name.str_pl: copies of The Guru Granth Sahib

description: A single-volume copy of the central religious texts of Sikhism.

name.str_pl: copies of Hadith

description: A Muslim religious text containing an account of the sayings and actions of the prophet Muhammad.

name.str_pl: copies of Principia Discordia

description: A book that embodies the main beliefs of Discordianism.  It seems to primarily concern chaos, and features a card in the back which informs you that you are now a 'genuine and authorized Pope of Discordia'.

name.str_pl: copies of The Kojiki

description: The oldest extant chronicle of Japan's myths and history, the stories contained in the Kojiki are part of the inspiration behind Shinto practices.

name.str_pl: copies of The Book of Mormon

description: The sacred text of the Latter Day Saint movement of Christianity, originally published in 1830 by Joseph Smith.

name.str: The Gospel of the Flying Spaghetti Monster
name.str_pl: copies of The Gospel of the Flying Spaghetti Monster

description: A book that embodies the main beliefs of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster.  It seems to involve a lot of pirates and some sort of invisible drunken monster made of pasta.

name.str_pl: copies of Quran

description: An English translation of the Muslim book of holy scriptures, with explanatory notes and commentaries to aid in understanding.

name.str_pl: copies of The Satanic Bible

description: A collection of essays, observations, and rituals published by Anton LaVey in 1969.

name.str_pl: copies of Dianetics

description: This book is the canonical text of Scientology.  Written by a science fiction author, it contains self-improvement techniques and musings on psychology called Dianetics.

name.str_pl: copies of The Book of the SubGenius

description: A book about the Church of the SubGenius.  It seems to involve a salesman named J. R. "Bob" Dobbs and a concept called 'slack'.

name.str_pl: copies of The Sutras of the Buddha

description: A collection of discourses attributed to the Buddha and his close disciples.

name.str_pl: volumes of the Talmud

description: One of the central texts of Rabbinic Judaism, the Talmud expounds upon the Hebrew Bible with teachings and opinions of thousands of rabbis.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 1, Tractate Berakhot (Part 1)

variants.description: This is volume 1 of 51, containing the first part of Tractate Berakhot.  It is concerned with rules relating to the Shema and the Amidah.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 2, Tractate Berakhot (Part 2)

variants.description: This is volume 2 of 51, containing the second part of Tractate Berakhot.  It is concerned with rules relating to prayers, primarily those before or after eating but it also touches on prayers that occur on special occasions such as hearing thunder or being unexpectedly delivered from danger.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 3, Tractate Pe'ah

variants.description: This is volume 3 of 51, containing Tractate Pe'ah.  It is concerned with agriculture, of harvesting, and providing food for the poor.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 4, Tractate Demai

variants.description: This is volume 4 of 51, containing Tractate Demai.  It is concerned with rules for dubiously-tithed produce.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 5, Tractate Kilayim

variants.description: This is volume 5 of 51, containing Tractate Kilayim.  It is concerned with prohibitions on the mixing of different kinds, such as wearing wool and linen clothing or planting anything other than grapes in a vineyard.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 6a, Tractate Shevi'it (Part 1)

variants.description: This is volume 6a of 51, containing the first part of Tractate Shevi'it.  It is concerned with the Shemitah year, the seventh year where fields must lie fallow.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 6b, Tractate Shevi'it (Part 2)

variants.description: This is volume 6b of 51, containing the second part of Tractate Shevi'it.  It continues the discussion of the Shemitah year, the seventh year where fields must lie fallow.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 7, Tractate Terumot (Part 1)

variants.description: This is volume 7 of 51, containing the first part of Tractate Terumot.  It is concerned with terumot, portions of agriculture produce that are given directly to the Kohanim priestly class.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 8, Tractate Terumot (Part 2)

variants.description: This is volume 8 of 51, containing the second part of Tractate Terumot.  It is continues the discussion of terumot, portions of agriculture produce that are given directly to the Kohanim priestly class.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 9, Tractate Maasrot

variants.description: This is volume 9 of 51, containing Tractate Maasrot.  It is concerned with the separation of the harvest into tithes, and the portions given to the Tribe of Levi, the poor, or the people of Jerusalem.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 10, Tractate Maaser Sheni

variants.description: This is volume 10 of 51, containing Tractate Maaser Sheni.  It is concerned with the practice of consuming a portion of the yearly harvest in Jerusalem, or exchanging it for money used to buy food in Jerusalem to hold a feast.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 11, Tractate Challah

variants.description: This is volume 11 of 51, containing Tractate Challah.  It is concerned with the practice of baking bread with the first portion of harvested grain and tithing it as an offering.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 12, Tractate Orlah & Bikkurim

variants.description: This is volume 12 of 51, containing Tractates Orlah and Bikkurim.  Both tractates discuss the practice of letting a fruit tree grow for three years before harvesting it.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 13, Tractate Shabbat (Part 1)

variants.description: This is volume 13 of 51, containing the first part of Tractate Shabbat.  It discusses the thirty-nine types of prohibited labor

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 14, Tractate Shabbat (Part 2)

variants.description: This is volume 14 of 51, containing the second part of Tractate Shabbat.  It discusses the prohibitions of carrying items or transporting animals on Shabbat.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 15, Tractate Shabbat (Part 3)

variants.description: This is volume 15 of 51, containing the third part of Tractate Shabbat.  It discusses the positive commandments of Shabbat, such as lighting candles and eating a festive meal, and continues the discussion of prohibited types of labor.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 16, Tractate Eruvin (Part 1)

variants.description: This is volume 16 of 51, containing the first part of Tractate Eruvin.  It discusses the ways to expand the allowable areas in which one may carrying items or transport items on Shabbat.

name.str_pl: copies of the Talmud, Vol. 17, Tractate Eruvin (Part 2)

variants.description: This is volume 17 of 51, containing the second part of Tractate Eruvin.  It continues discussing the ways to expand the allowable areas in which one may carrying items or transport items on Shabbat.

name.str_pl: copies of Tanakh

description: A single-volume book containing the complete canon of the Jewish Bible.

name.str_pl: copies of The Tripitaka

description: A collection of sacred Buddhist writings describing their canons of scriptures.

name.str_pl: copies of The Upanishads

description: A collection of sacred Hindu writings regarding the nature of reality and describing the character and form of human salvation.

name.str_pl: copies of The Four Vedas

description: A single volume containing all four Vedas, which are the oldest scriptures of Hinduism.

name.str_pl: copies of H치vam치l

description: An English translation of several Old Norse poems.  The poems contain proverbs and stories attributed to the god Odin, many transcribed from oral history.
